title: Hoven - Free Access
content:
Chester Hoven, 85, of Jackson passed away Sept. 7, 2015 at his residence. 

He was born Jan. 17, 1930. He was owner of Hoven’s Upholstery. He was a U.S. Army Veteran. He was a founding member of the Clarke-Washington Coon Hunter’s Association. He was actively involved in the Elvis Roberts Memorial Coon Hunt which raised money for St. Jude’s Hospital. He was a loving father, husband, grandfather and friend. 

Survivors include his children, Chester R. (Glenda) Hoven, Amanda J. (Donnie) Havelin, all of Dalton, Ga., Sharon H. Bumpers, Tammy L. (Darrell) Parnell, all of Jackson, Roxie A. Hoven, Norfolk, Virginia; grandchildren, Alicia (Doug) Morgan, Benjamin Knapp, Lauren Havelin, Kate Havelin; great-grandchildren, Daniel Morgan, Peyton Morgan; beloved nieces, Mary Hilt, Wanda (Raymond) Pugh; countless friends, family and loved ones. 

He was preceded in death by his wife of 49 years, Mildred A. Hoven; his twin sister, Esther H. Maxwell; sister, Gladys Chandler and parents, Atwood and Emma Hoven. 

Visitation will be Tuesday, Sept. 8 from 5-7 p.m. and Wednesday, Sept. 9 from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. at Lathan Funeral Home in Jackson. The service will be Wednesday, Sept. 9 at 12:15 p.m.  at Stave Creek Baptist Church in Jackson. Burial will be at Stave Creek Baptist Church Cemetery. 

Active pallbearers will be Jason Sullivan, Charles Hixson, Robert Michael “Tank” Wilson, Jimmy Chancey, Chester Anderson and Raymond Pugh. 

Honorary pallbearers will be Dink Lankford, Larry Parnell, Woody Parnell, Andy Parnell, Sammy Hoven, Tim Sullivan, Grady Griffin, Ed Guy and Carey Parker. 

Condolences may be offered at www.lathanfuneralhomejackson.com . 

Lathan Funeral Home of Jackson directed. 

(34-1tp)
